rather, that's what an en banc *review* is. "en banc" just means "the whole court". sometimes cases will be heard by the whole court instead of just 3 judges. reply_context.text: If a judge that wasn't on a case thinks it was judged poorly, they can petition for a review by all the judges assigned to that circuit court. This is what "en banc" is. It's an opportunity to reverse a bad ruling and for the rest of the judges to publicly call bullshit on bad faith behavior.
